alert.note: Alert for Coffey (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 14 at 5:22PM CDT until May 14 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Coffey County in east central Kansas... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 522 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southeast of Hartford, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... New Strawn, Beto Junction and John Redmond Reservoir. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 151 and 156. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
